SourcedStatement: San Francisco recently ramped up its effort to offer homeless people bus tickets out of town as part of its Journey Home program.
Name: San Francisco
Justification: Initiator of the Journey Home program

SourcedStatement: Humboldt County officials voted Tuesday to send a letter raising the alarm about San Francisco’s plans to bus homeless people out of the city.
Name: Humboldt County
Justification: Affected party responding to San Francisco’s Journey Home program

SourcedStatement: When asked for comment, the San Francisco mayor’s office said it had not received the letter.
Name: San Francisco Mayor’s Office
Justification: Official response to Humboldt County’s letter

SourcedStatement: “We were dismayed to learn that our small, rural county was among the top three destinations in the state where people experiencing homelessness were sent by the program,”
Name: Humboldt County officials (no specific person named in this statement, but included as it's a direct quote from the draft letter)
Justification: Authors of the draft letter to San Francisco Mayor London Breed

SourcedStatement: “The aim isn’t to achieve a goal. It’s to get you out of our town, and it’s cheaper than arresting you,”
Name: Paul Boden
Title: Homeless advocate with the Western Regional Advocacy Project

SourcedStatement: “The No. 1 answer to homelessness is to make them disappear. Then mayors write letters back and forth: ‘Stop sending your people here.’ Then it turns out they’re sending their people here. It shows the ridiculousness of us not trying to address why people are on the streets.”
Name: Paul Boden
Title: Homeless advocate with the Western Regional Advocacy Project

SourcedStatement: “Our TAP program works really well, and hopefully San Francisco can go back to more — not just dumping — but assisting and actually helping people get help,”
Name: Rex Bohn
Title: Humboldt Supervisor
Justification: Relevant authority on Humboldt County’s relocation program

SourcedStatement: According to SF’s Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing and the Human Services Agency, Los Angeles and Sacramento counties are the two other most popular California destinations.
Name: SF’s Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing and the Human Services Agency
Justification: Used as a reliable source for data on Journey Home program destinations

SourcedStatement: According to the program’s website, social services staffers verify that those who use TAP will be received at their destination by a relative, friend, or appropriate agency.
Name: Humboldt’s Transportation Assistance Program (TAP) website
Justification: Official website providing information on program operations
